comments.body:
To match Java further, the game should also pause when writing on a Sign/Hanging Sign, writing in a Book, in certain screens like the loading and credits screens, and when confirming whether to leave the game or not through the You Died screen. If I missed anywhere else where the game were to pause on Java, should apply to Bedrock as well.

Edit: Here's some more areas on where the game should pause on Bedrock: when your controller disconnects and when the game is idle.

Two thumbs up!

I'd even argue for the option to log me out if someone logs in when I'm paused.
We used to be able to properly pause the game back on the Xbox 360/Xbox One Versions, so I'd be very glady if that could return.
I agree with 1st and 2nd

This post should now be marked as announced!

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360009305432-Ability-to-pause-single-player-games-Bedrock
If you are in a local world you host in multiplayer, the game should pause entirely once every single player that has joined is on the pause menu.

Thank you for implementing this heavily requested feature. To get straight to the point, here are a few things involving this pausing feature that should be addressed:

1. Please use this new pausing function to properly fix the various bugs that have been haphazardly addressed or not fixed at all. These issues include:

  • MCPE-186726/MCPE-186753 (Entities (Armor Stands, Villagers) drop down one block when reloaded)
  • MCPE-42310 (Players can spawn in and take damage or die before the world loads correctly)
  • MCPE-180268 (When you open a world, simulation begins before chunks, entities, redstone, and player controls finish loading)

2. Please allow the game to be paused when playing Couch/Local Co-op Multiplayer if not already possible.

3. Please consider adding the /tick freeze command to bedrock in a future update now that the game has the ability to pause.

4. The pause function should also pause all background music or sounds in the game. For more information, please see MCPE-188466.

5. Please try to achieve full parity on the pause mechanic. Where the game decides to freeze or not freeze should be the same on both versions of the game.
This is a great feature, this is a good step in the right direction for bedrock edition, and bringing parity closer with java!

thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you thank you‚ù§

HOLY COW YOU GUYS FINALLY DID IT!!!!!!!! I have 650 HOURS on the Switch and it drove me crazy how there's no pausing in singleplayer!!! (Of course Legacy console edition had this from the start and it was taken away in the conversion to Bedrock grumble grumble)

I agree with what some others are saying in that it should match Java edition in every case where Java pauses. Also there's some delay between opening the menu and it pausing so it feels a little sluggish. In my opinion, the background should be dimmed in the pause menu to better reflect that it's paused and it would look better to me. 

Anyway this is a GREAT step forward in improving Bedrock! Good job on finally adding it!
This should be the default behavior and not be a toggle.
Hokey smokes, I can pause now?
Eu amei essa adi√ß√£o, vai ajudar muito em v√°rias ocasi√µes
OMG FINALLY EVERYTIME I HAVE TO LEAVE MY DEVICE WHILE PLAYING SURVIVAL, I ALWAYS HAVE TO SAVE AND EXIT! FINALLY!!!
This is a fantastic change - especially the fact that it's optional. Everyone wins.

This feature was wonderful addition to my bedrock edition experience until it suddenly stopped working.

It no longer pauses on my main file that I have put all my time and effort into. I have pausing turned on and it works for every other file but this one. It seems as though something about uploading this world to realms and downloading it between multiple devices has caused some sort of issue.

being able to Un-pause when other users join isss only a bedrock edition exclusive. java edition doesn't have this, no one would want to have others be able to unpause their game, please change this to be consistent with java.
this would be so helpful! I love to play Minecraft while i watch my shows. Being able to pause my game would be a literal game-changer!

Thanks for choosing to delay the Pause feature rather than releasing it unfinished in the 1.21.60 update. There are still many issues relating to pausing that must be fixed. Below you can find some of them, along with their Bug tracker codes.

Critical Issues:

  • MCPE-188456   Unfocusing then focusing the game window causes the game to momentarily unpause.
  • MCPE-188466   Sounds still play while the game is paused.
  • MCPE-188497   Game cannot be paused when the "Operator Commands" permission is disabled.

Graphical Issues:

  • MCPE-188459   Animated blocks still play their animation when the game is paused (Relates to MCPE-188461 & MCPE-188464 as it also affects particles and fire).
  • MCPE-188478   Pause menu doesn't blur the background
  • MCPE-188510   Pause menu background is completely transparent
  • MCPE-190218   Bow, crossbow, trident, shield, and spyglass are positioned incorrectly when the game is paused (seems to affects items with attachables or data driven items).
  • MCPE-189923   Camera fade effects still plays when the game is paused.

Movement Issues:

  • MCPE-188484 & MCPE-188475   Player leaves their previous movement state when the game is paused.
  • MCPE-188471   Player can't continue walking immediately after unpausing.

Animation Issues:

  • MCPE-188467   Eating, toothing, and charging animations immediately reset to default position when the game is paused (Relates to MCPE-188485 & MCPE-190290).
  • MCPE-189995   Player models does not instantly follows camera rotation when the game is unpaused.

I think this is a good for when your about to fall in lava or die you can pause the game to think what you can to! I have Minecraft preview and when I tried this feature it felt great to pause in midair. Keep up the great work and have a great day!

I feel like this is nice, but the fact that when you go to another tab Minecraft pauses makes this idea a bit bad since automatic farms don't work if you're doing something else which is super annoying. I think we should add a pause button on the pause menu to pause the game, but not immediately pause the game when entering the pause menu.

It would be nice if this also worked on a Realm--assuming you're the only one logged in--because there's functionally no reason it shouldn't as it works the same as a local server. Sure, have it gated behind the Realm Admin having to enable it in settings (I went looking just to try to do that). My friend and I just play as a pair and 30-50% of the time only one of us is playing, we simply use the Realm for convienience so we can play whenever/from wherever without worrying about someone leaving the world up. Would just be nice to have the option as Admin to allow single-player pausing on a Realm.
Laft hand use button pleaseüôèü•∫
Thanks! That will be a good idea if the person who's playing Minecraft has to do something else.
so what about the new pause feature, it's really nice but why did you write this like you didn't suggest anything so why was this written. there is no point.
I'm down with combat and magic. A perfect combination.
Thank you Blast Burner and Bills4Life7 for the support!

I think this post is going to become obsolete now that Mojang is looking into combat. I'm excited that they will finally fix it, apprehensive that Mojang might leave us with a substandard combat system again, and disappointed that my idea didn't gain traction. I will post some new suggestions and concerns to the snapshot portion.

I don't know about weapon dipping to give your swords the ability to do magical attacks but more along the lines of possible new magical tools altogether. We already have enchantments that can make your arrows become on fire, I think the closest thing to magic we will get will be along the lines of new enchantments or a new system/table that is in the same style as the enchantment table for new magical tools or abilities/enchantments.

I thought of weapon dipping because of the current dipped arrows. This system would fit very well in the current system, and making the different materials have more viability, it would make people have more flexibility in choosing combat styles, perhaps a spell caster who uses a gold sword who wears a diamond suit. I guess he‚Äôd fight a person with full diamond. A player could fully customize his playstyle, pretty much making infinite possibilities for combat, which is currently limited to diamond everything and clicking and jumping.

also i think that it should be enchants instead of dipping because mojang doesn't want to have to code a multi layer mechanic if they could just use add on to one they already have but i still really like the idea

DearHealer726, what would the enchantment system work like? I am basing the dipping system off of the dipped arrows. I‚Äôm sure there could be enchantments that can tie into it, however. I think that Mojang could code it similarly to the way they coded the Tropical Fish Bucket, if they really need to, but I think that will not be required. Thank you for the feedback, and please clarify.

I feel like this would be a good time to introduce a staff into the game. It could be made with two sticks, and another block on top (Diamond tip would be better than iron, gold, and so on.) The top of the staff should be an entire block of resource, so it's not too easy to get. Like a block of diamond, block of emerald, block of gold, block of iron.

Perhaps this staff could be "dipped" like they are saying above, or they could have a new enchantment table with different types of spells and some of the older enchants.

Ex: Diamond Staff- Unbreaking Three, Mending, Fireball.

Ex: Golden Staff- Unbreaking Three, Mending, Shock.

This staff would allow you to shoot a magic ability of your enchantment choosing, while still utilizing much of the already existing features. Of course the top block would determine durability, the power of enchantments, and such like it does in the game now. Perhaps every time you used a spell, it would take some of your exp levels as a way to power your new weapon, and keep yourself continuing the game.
I think there should be non weapon based spells. I would also like more weapons, such as mauls. Crafting: stick, chain, and wood, stone, iron, gold, etc.
I do like magic and this would be fun for pvp and pve
I like the weapon dipping. Everything else may get a bit complicated

There are some cool ideas there, I want to emphatize in a pair of them:

Adding effectime downsides to using armor and giving more use to gold armor: Honestly, I've always felt weird that putting on a huge and very heavy full plated diamond armor and not having your speed or mobility affected. Moreover, giving Gold the property of protecting you better against magic damage is one of the coolest ideas I have ever seen, I may writte an entire post dedicated to this.

Spell Blades/Weapons: Honestly, that was a cool idea but I will give it a tweak. Submerging a sword or any other weapon into a cauldron full with a potion effect should absorb all the cauldron and change the weapon into a spell blade/weapon. The rest would be as you say.

Dipping isn't really magic in my opinion. The staff idea is long over due for magic (arts of conjure, destruction ect) to be introduced. But why stop at just staffs which simply can cast projectiles of certain elements, but why not utilize the free hand to hold arcane books, and having the fist (like Skyrim) have a color glow or flame. Experience bar would be the mana or add in a new bar and some sort of charging block that uses lapiz or redstone as source of power or mana potions. My world is long over due for a decent mages guild. (Thinking like Morrowind - teleportation, levitate,summon, destruction. Enchanting is a lower form a magic (smithing/arcane) same as with alchemy. We need the more respected arcane arts. Staff, Books, Wands, Robes... Just my opinion, Because dipping is more like putting poison on a blade then "magic"...

Keep stacking and remember to blink! ;)
I was going to post something like this. Jeb has been working on a combat update, so magic could also receive an update.
me gustar√≠a que el sistema de combate fuera como la versi√≥n de java
Too complicated and messy for pvp.
me parece buena tu idea pero esto va en el futuro de minecrastf en una actualizacion magica
üëç, but we also need SIEGE WEAPONS, LIKE ON AGE OF EMPIRES! I WANT SIEGE WEAPONS!
I agree asking as it's all temporary it feels to peremanate I like to have some things permanently but it still is a survival game
Yeah this is a good idea, it keeps it consistent with the other properties of copper.

I don‚Äôt think a lightning rod should reduce in effectiveness over time, given how rare storms are. Bad idea. I do think that the texture should be in line with the other copper blocks though visually.

I don't think it should have any mechanical changes at all - any that could be made would just change the game for the worse imo - but having the lightning rod in the greener colours would be fantastic for aesthetic building/detailing.
Any way you could move this to the Caves and Cliffs category? Less posts there so more people will see this.
That seems nice
It fits with 1.21 and the every other copper item so well.

I certainly agree with the addition of mouse support.  As a programmer myself, since the layouts would structurally be nearly the same to Windows 10, I would not think it would be difficult to migrate the Windows control settings to iPadOS.
This would be an amazing addition considering apples new keyboard and iPad Air with the apple a14 chip, plus they added support in games for keyboard and mouse at wwdc 2020. Come on Mojang!!

This needs to happen; the settings even reference keyboard support! Touch on the iPhone is alright but the iPad screen is too big so you end up hitting things by accident (or in my case falling into lava...)
this would be my dream come true, pls do it!
We need this happen.
Please get this off the ground!!

We really shouldn‚Äôt have to make a damn petition to get this feature! The game already has a keyboard and mouse tab in the controls menu on iOS. iPads have had mouse support for well over a year now, almost 2. This feature should have been added a long ago! Come on Microsoft you have one of the worlds most popular games here, you made a damn 3DS port... you can spend a little bit of resources on a control method that already exists for other versions of the game. Pfft F***ing inexcusable.
Also Samsung's recent phones like the S20 and S21 has 12hz display
How is this not a thing yet? Minecraft PE on iPhone 13 Pro support 120fps mode but not on iPad Pro?
Why is not support 120 in iPad Pro m2?
It's 18th of July already and still no 120fps support on iPad Pro. So much time has passed and so many updates were released...
Great idea! But a bit overpowered... Maybe balance with an extremely high enchantment weight?
Only to be found in nether fortress no more ways

I think this would balance well with the addition of some type of deadly lava monster in the nether. The only thing really gained with this enchantment is it would make exploring the nether a bit easier, but it should still be very dangerous to try.
This could just be a second ability of the Frost Walker enchantment
Another great idea that would make the new netherite boots special! I would personally love to see this implemented into the game!

How about Frost Walker II:

As you may know, frost walker allows you to walk on magma blocks (no crouch) without being damaged. This is most likely due to the frost aspect which cools down the magma. But what if Frost Walker II were to be even colder, solidifying lava into magma temporarily before melting back up into lava. Using the same logic, it would mean that while walking on water the temperature will drop more than the first enchantment and therefore the ice could be blue ice instead of the packed ice texture (for further esthetics).

Of course, like the frosted ice, the magma and "blue ice" issued from the enchantment would not be harvestable and will disapear after some time.

The magma could disappear faster than the frosted ice as lava melts things faster than water. On the other hand, blue ice would stay longer than frosted ice because it is colder and will melt slower.

Although this proposal is somewhat different than your original idea, it has the same core idea and it would be unnecessary to create a new thread for a similar idea. (it would also spread the votes thin)

This would be an interesting addition to the game and would allow for better on foot travel in the nether.

Suggestion to keep it balanced! It lets you walk on lava but you still take burn damage. You would never fall deep into lava again and have no escape but you‚Äôre still at some risk. This damage could be negated with a fire res potion so you could easily travel in the nether!
Maybe it could only be found in the nether fortress or traded with the new mobs in the nether update
There is no need for this enchantment anymore as we are getting striders a mob that you can ride over lava

I was thinking maybe frost walker should affect lava by turning it into magma, but with a significantly smaller radius and duration than ice with water. It might also steal durability from the boots to make it slightly costly.
Omggggggggg this is the best idea ever. I was about to write this when I saw this then liked it voted it and followed it
there could be a frost walker III enchantment that is extremely rare when bartering with piglins and it can only be applied to netherite boots and you can walk on water and lava with this envhantment

There could be an enchantment called Lava Strider which simply allows you to walk on lava without turning it to magma. I do like the idea of a Frost Walker II enchantment that makes lava turn to magma. Perhaps the Strider enchantment simply allows you to walk on liquids without affecting their state
This should be a enchantment found in bastions as a final reward. I love this idea of traveling the lava oceans.
To add more balance, it could possibly be put on netherite boots, and only found in Bastions/Nether fortresses, or by trading with piglins.
For balance you can make it only found in nether
This is actually so smart I would love this

Yes! I really don't like the flying in bedrock, and on top of that i feel that the sprinting and opening inventory is clunky, why is there input lag when opening your inventory and why does sprinting just stop sometimes and stop and go and etc. but its mostly the very stiff flying in creative on bedrock. Some people say they prefer the stiff flying without momentum from bedrock but i much prefer having that bit of momentum that java already has
there should be an option to toggle momentum on and off
How about /SimpleFly @p [bool] (Def: True) and /SimpleFly @p Snap [MoveDegrees] (Def: 45, Choices: 15, 30, 45, or 90) that way, if someone want to make a big, perfect circle, they can.
I agree. Flying on bedrock using a console doesn't exactly feel right.

Yes please, being a player who has played on Java edition for years now, it's hard to get used to the non drifty flying of Bedrock. It'd be nice for some option to enable that kind of flying in the controls or something.
I hope they change this. I host servers for friends and am constantly in creative, its very annoying to not have the drift in flying.

I‚Äôm noticing some contradiction here. A lot of people are saying that drifty feeling went away with the Bedrock update, but on PS4, that drifty mechanic was added with Bedrock. I can no longer fly in a perfectly straight line which makes it very difficult for me to build, especially since I‚Äôm working on a city build and everything is squared off. Ive been working on this build for over 5 years now and would hate to just throw it away because the control mechanics are making it nearly impossible to continue.

@Cory Smart: You‚Äôre talking about a different ‚Äúdrifting‚Äù effect. You actually -are- moving in a straight line in PS4 bedrock, straight along the x/y/z axis. It just looks like you aren‚Äôt because you‚Äôre turning your camera in the direction you want to move up and down, which is how the PS4 flying used to work.. now you have to press R3 and X instead (to move in a straight line along that axis).

The other people are talking about the ‚Äúdrift‚Äù of momentum.

Also, I agree the bedrock flying controls are horrible and they should have been changed to match the old PS4 controls before pushing out this update.

My kids refuse to play bedrock because they can‚Äôt control the flying (they want to use the camera to go up/down like what you are referring to.. which had a much better feel to it). I hate the flying because it‚Äôs too slow.

I agree with having an option to turn off flying drift. I thought that this would still be a good feature to add for many people, sorry for commenting on an old post. The option would be to turn on and off the "drifting" in Creative Mode.

It's where momentum continues to carry the player forward when they have stopped pushing on the analog stick or pressing W. It happens while flying and feels like we're on ice.

I'm used to the old PS3 Creative Mode, where if you stop pressing the button to move, your player stops instantly. It makes the movement in creative mode a lot easier. I've also heard that some people get motion sickness from the drifty, icy movement.

It would be the best to add an option instead of making the game use one way of flying or the other, I think. That way if you like the original flying, then you could leave it on.
Flying like java in bedrock
I'm so sick of the bedrock flying that I'm considering either going back to minecraft xbox 360 edition or quitting minecraft altogether
I really miss the flying on the old PS4 version. I'm still playing the old version because of this. It's sad because i really want to play Bedrock version, but i can't handle the drifty controls.
Very nice suggestion, not only for tnt cannons but also other redstone contraptions. Parity is always something to strive for!
Very nice
üòä
I really hope this goes through
would be awesome
I agree with this, 1.7.10 was king with many of its mechanics, but this one is necessary specifically in redstone mechanics, and in factions while others may be luxury mechanics.
Would be quite helpful for many contraptions.
Rephrase Title to "(Java Parity) No offhand restrictions"
The reason you don't have many votes is the title. Your description should be the title. Hope this helps.
For android
This is probably something I've wanted for years now
Rodrigo
Rodrigo
Hi po
Qu√© a√±adan capibaras en Minecraft
New water sounds are terrible
add capybaras
This is needed, for sure. Why can't we already do this??

I‚Äôve got a solution for all players

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/39240045514893-Offhand-For-bedrock-System-idea-For-all-users
We want off hand in bedrock we can put anything in your office hand like java please add it
Yes like defeating a dragon in one special weekend , and then you get a cape for a java and a bedrock
I completely agree.
Darriusc71
Players
Hy
I feel like if we have emotes now we should get a cape creator or capes as rewards at least
I love ot
I would love capes as rewards because than we can have different capes depending on whitch reward we get  :)
What if it was a cape for each final achievement (The last achievements in the achievement tree).
I like this idead beacuse i don't know how to get capes and i play lots of survial
The online aspect of Minecraft is pretty easy as it is, third party servers have their own way of running things.. But realms and single player are quite easy to get started with
I completely agree, I dont want to buy a router just to play with friends. This is way easier on other versions.
Note that if he is playing on bedrock edition, it's the simplest thing. If he is playing Java Edition, it's easy to find a public server.

I agree, what a great idea! Minecraft would be the 1st to connect all platforms but that would take its very own form of internet. Right? I mean the game has already come a long way as far as connecting players. It would be exceptionally cool to have Xbox , phone, tablet, computer etc. Players all together. I like this idea but don't know what it would take to make this a reality.

What do you mean it's difficult? It's one of the easiest things to do. On Java you have access to plenty of already existing servers and possibility to create a private server easily both for free or with a little fee. On Bedrock, all you need to do is to have your friends added on Xbox Live platform. And both versions also have Realms subscription, which makes things even easier.
Quero jogar online na vers√£o beta o que eu fasso
Nao estou conseguindo adicionar minha amiga porque tem alguma falha oque eu fa√ßo???
It is very hard for me to add my friends and play on realms even though I am signed into my Microsoft account. Please solve this problem to make it easier to play with my friends and play on realms.
I agree how do you do it though?
How to play With friends
Nathing but I won't to play with friends
Don show me friends onlinr

64 is not arbitrary, it's due to how binary numbers work.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer_number_format

So in order to change the max stack size to 100 they would have to change how the game records the number of items in a stack.
Maybe instead of adding a higher limit, instead make an item that will let you stack up to 128 and 256 depending on the item.

64 is good. If you made it bigger imagine trying to split stacks...

nightmare
Not a good idea. 64 is a good number because it is easy to split into halves, quarters, eighths, sixteenths, etc. so it is a very convenient number to work with.
64 is about right.
I think instead there should be a command to disable stacking limits making all items stack up to 64.
whats the point?
I would not want it to bee 100, because that would make it too easy. Maybe in Peaceful?
They can just edit all the 64s to 100s, but that is not gonna be very beautiful in my eyes.
They probably juat decided ro store otems as shorts or bytes. Also this would really feel wierd.
Stacks of 64 is Minecraft and changing this to anything higher would piss off a huge amount of the community

100 isnt possible or if it is its to hard and unlikely, however they could try 99 size stacks. 

     pros of 99:

It is still 2 digits

Divisible by 4,6,8, and 9

Still non arbitrary

 

     cons of 99:

Its not even and will offend people with OCD

Would piss of all the OG players who cant handle simple changes

99 isn't even even, much less divisible by 8.

 

I have found myself wishing for higher stack sizes too, but it will never be changed because it has been accepted as 64 now. And that's fine.
No! Please no! Plus, some items stack up to 16, like enderpearls, and some don't stack at all.
Not good for Redstone...
That would work as anythung up to 127 should work but i think i would rather have 64 as it has been the limit since alpha
Dude its binary limitations
There was a time in pre-alpha when you could stack up to '999+' items. Therefore, it is likely that the maximum stack size is 65,535, the 16-bit integer limit.
maybe not 100, do 128. That way it will split into 64 and it is a larger number
I am against this. I rather have a smooth running game than having high numbers.
64 is kinda a Iconic number to the Game so I think it works, also Shulker Boxes would just be easier to Crash Big Servers if this was a Thing

I believe 64 was chosen because it‚Äôs 2 digits long and easily divisible by 2 (being a power of 2). The game can already provide stacks of up to 127 of any item through commands which means the game probably stores signed bytes (can go from -127 to 127). Since the negative numbers are unnecessary, the type could be changed to an unsigned byte like effects, allowing stacks to be up to 255 items.

most of you (the previous commenters) are complete idiots. 64 being an acceptable size? when? do you see in literally any other game where 64 or some random number of the like was the stacking size? that's more of a "dart board" number, than someone actually putting thought into how many items could be put into one stack, before starting a new one.

now i do understand this whole game's "thing" is about constructing creative builds for simple tasks; but the amount of large chests needed to store "good enough" amounts of items is blatantly ridiculous, unacceptable, and just overall stupid by gaming standards. i've yet to see anything about storage spaces being increased over the years of updates or any new chest having more than the typical amount of slots; but i have seen updates where new items were intro-ed yet we're still dealing with the same ol space limits. as i'm sure we've all seen; there's literal 100's of youtube videos with massive contraptions being build, just to store items. where the player has 10, 20, or even as much as 50 chests just to store one item. now multiply this by the amount of items in game, still feel like 64 is an acceptable amount? ha! give me a break. it shouldnt be 100, it should be a typeable option in the create world options for the player to decide.
388511781251 - you can make your point without namecalling. Consider yourself warned.
People saying that it isn't possible to increase stacksizes don't know what they're talking about

How about a button in the create world menu with all of the other settings that lets you change the stack limit of each item ingame? that will be cool! from a limit of 16 to 255, that will be very cool!

the game stores the stack size as a Java integer (32 bit signed integer) so the stack size can be up to 2 billion without changing the way the game stores the stack size. If 64 was the highest possible number then they would of needed to store it as a 6 bit unsigned integer or a 7 bit signed integer - which would be unnecessary, precarious and silly.

Increasing max stacks to 100 maybe can make your devices lagging. But, imagine increasing stack size to 1000, that would be so much and maybe could make your devices lag so that your device can't rely on your Minecraft and make your Minecraft crash instantly

I believe that stack sizes should be 999 instead of 64, even if only for building blocks, items, and crafting components. This is and has been the standard for all sandbox games this decade and even Minecraft of past (The pre-classic & survival test era of Minecraft), the stack size was 99, not 64. It for some reason, changed to 64 once it hit Indev. It doesn't help that with the stack size being 64, its very easy to insta-mine a entire parameter with haste 2 beacons and fill up your chest and shulkers in a matter of minutes and then spend the next hour moving all that to your storage room which isn't in that cave. Too easy to fill up your inventory and it takes too long to empty it our or move it. Even if 64 is seen as "iconic", this is actively wasting the time of many builders, players, and storage room expansions.

This stack size increase would ensure moving day in-game doesn't feel like moving day in real life; painful and slow despite being able to fly and carry tons in Shulker Boxes in-game unlike real life. This would solve one of the many inventory problems Minecraft is suffering from and would let us spend less time moving items and more time building with those bigger stacks.

I've always liked the idea of adding temperature. I would like having a good reason to use leather armor, and the thought of having to be extra careful around lava or ice makes my spine tingle a little bit. Having crop growth speed affected by temperature is also neat. So I'm glad you brought the idea up.

However, I'm just not sure it's a great idea overall because it will make lots of things in the game harder without making much of anything easier. Therefore, people might have a hard time accepting it... It's also so terribly complex, as you said. What if different foods had different effects on temperature, too? I might come back to this later and elaborate some more.

Would there be a high end armor, like diamond, that would protect you from both hyper and hypothermia?  I don't particularly like the idea of having to worry about temperature in the game, but I could tolerate it if I could ignore it once I get the right armor.

This seems like the kind of thing that could be enabled for people who want more of a challenge, like turning off natural regen or making death permanent.  Because some people are more into the "survival" aspect, and other people see it as an annoyance as much as anything.
I think this would be much better as a minecraft mod idea.

Great Idea! I had a very similar thought, but with a little bit of variation.

 First of all, not every Biome would have these "temperature effects", only the extreme ones: Deserts, Extreme Hills, very cold snow Biomes or even the Deep Ocean biomes.

 Also, it would be annoying if a player just walks into a biome and died from some kind of effect, so my idea was: the 1st. 1-2min. no effect, 3-4min. slight freezing effects such as hunger, slowness and then after being in the biome for more then 5min. the player will experience hunger, slowness, nausea, and slowly die. 

Also, I like the idea of Armor/Protection, but, hot or cold drinks or food that would help with the extreme cold or hot temperatures would be a cool addition too.

And because these biomes would be fairly dangerous, there should be some kind of reward: some kind of ruins, structures or special things spawn in these biomes that will give the player some kind of reward for surviving the harshes conditions in the game.

 Anyways, again, great comment, and I would love it if they actually added something similar to our ideas!

There is already a biome temperature, and it decreases with height! That could be used for this. 

But I think being too hot should burn you, and being too cold slow you down like slowness 2.
Nice idea, but no air coolers

I support this idea 100% and think it should be an optional thing, because it would make the game survival super-hard. Also, here's an idea: wearing golden armour protects you from all cold, heat, Nether effects, et cetera.

The randomization aspect of weapons in the In Survival part of the post especially caught my eye. I believe Minecraft will greatly benefit from more flexibility and depth of tool/weapon modifications, and the mentioned suggestion makes it work quite well.

The overall idea of the post is great as well, as it technically settles the years-long dispute between the two sides of the Minecraft community. There's something for everyone, which is great.

Either way, I voted. Lets hope others will do the same.

I'm all for this. This is essentially the great middle the community has been starving for.

To be completely honest, I really like the decay idea... but I also liked the "charge-up" feel that came with the current system.
To fix this, we simply need to get a new "Charge" enchantment, and this would be all good.

The weight system is what really makes this idea shine! It makes the decay different based on the item's set weight, so one could actually strategize what tools to use!

Definite +1

Well thought out and presented! I‚Äôm totally on board! As a big-time axe fighter since 1.9, I‚Äôve been looking for something like this for a long time! The weapon randomization idea is amazing, too- it would give a great feel to the game to have weapons that are customized in more ways than just the enchantments you put on. And looting the outer end would become just way better.
I feel like the randomized weapons could benefit from a few more changing variables, too- maybe max durability, attack range and base knockback too? Armour from loot chests could also benefit from that... I‚Äôm getting away from myself- your idea made me too excited.

Great idea! I've always liked the 1.9 system, but was also disappointed at how few other players liked it. This could create the balance needed to reunite the two halves.

The weaponhand idea was cool, too - But I feel like being able to use a bow and a sword simultaneously would be a little overpowered. People can do that right now, anyway, but at the cost having a shield.

It would also be interesting, if, in light of your weapon weight system, different tiers would have different advantages, including but not limited to weight - For instance, gold might be heavy and easily broken but it's easy to enchant, as it is now, or diamond gear could be extra durable, but not as powerful as iron.
This is just too good.

Lots of good ideas. My only fear is that players will just go to the wiki and find out which has the highest dps and just always use that one. There would need to be careful balance and a bigger difference between weapons to make sure each is viable and the choice is up to the player.

Some ideas:
- Short swords can be dual wielded, can be spam clicked, have the highest dps but they don't damage shields to encourage attacking from the side or back.
- Swords can cleave more effectively than currently allowing hitting multiple enemies.
- Hammers ignore shields and do heavy damage to armour meaning they work best against single armoured targets.
- Spear
When you are holding a spear on a horse you do damage to any mobs you hit while riding on the horse. A spear could also be used off the horse, it has a longer reach than a sword but a slow recharge time.

Oh, this is much more reasonable! It reminds me of the weapons capacitors on the ships in the old Star Wars Galaxies MMO, if any of you remember it. Each pull of the trigger subtracted from the capacitor's charge, but the capacitor recharged over time. You could drain it entirely with a full auto barrage, but then your rate of fire would slow to a crawl and your salvos would be weakened.

Your plan also has the effect of progressively decreasing the hit power. I just REALLY LIKE the sound of how this would work. It sounds delightfully intuitive, like it would have EXCELLENT Game Feel. I crave to experience this.

I Wholeheartedly Support this!

Edit: upon further consideration, although you've made your intentions clear that you want, specifically, more WEAPONS in the game... I think it would be more efficient and more "Minecrafty" on a development and implementation angle if we actually used the existing tools:

Hoes behaving as short swords (quick hits with a short sharp blade)

Swords remaining swords,

Axes remaining axes, 

And shovels behaving as hammers. (Slow heavy hits with a broad blunt impact) 

Your dual wielding proposition also is very promising.

Concept: An optional Thirst system to add survival depth, rewarding preparation with positive buffs.

Core Mechanics:

Slow Depletion: Thirst decreases over 2-3 game days. Visual warnings appear before any health loss.

Risk/Reward Drinking: Drink from any source, but unsafe water may cause brief Nausea.

Progression: Craft a Waterskin (early), use Glass Bottles, or collect rain in Cauldrons for safe "Fresh Water."

Key Reward: A "Hydrated" buff (e.g., faster health regen) makes it strategic, not a chore.

Enriches Gameplay:

Biomes Matter: Thirst drains faster in deserts, adding challenge.

Food Use: Soups and melons also replenish thirst.

New Potions: Potion of Endurance could slow thirst drain.

Crucially Optional:

A game rule ( /gamerule naturalThirst false ) or Hard-mode only feature.

Summary:

Encourages exploration, deepens strategy, and is completely optional. Thank you!
